resources.string: Share your address with your partner
And ask your partner to provide you their address
Partner address field will be filled automatically
Last partner address saving is disabled
Do you want to end conversation?
Unfortunately, there is a problem with the STUN server. Try to change STUN server.
StunWire service is ready to work
Unfortunately, an error has occurred while receiving address
Please check the input. Example: domain.name:65536
Unfortunately, unable to share key image
Message is loading or content type is unsupported by this version of the app, try to update

The goal of this application is to provide ability to establish direct encrypted connection via Internet with the partner without any servers and without dependency on any service infrastructure. This application can also be used for educational purposes. All the sources are available at the GitHub.

If we want to send a letter to some person, we have to know their address. It works exactly similar for the Internet connections. A server that is placed somewhere in the Internet which is available to connect always has it\'s domain name or at least known IP address, the address which is used to connect to the server. But what will happen if we want to connect not to the server, but to some other client, the ordinal network user? Ordinal users do not have their own static address to connect to. Instead, the ISP (Internet Service Provider), the company which provides Internet services to the user, \"divides\" the address between many users. Any request from particular user is then assigned a unique number (a port). So, in the case we want to connect to ordinal person via Internet, their address will be [IP address]:[Port] pair. If we know the pair, we can connect to the user.
NO! Due to technical limitations only a Wi-Fi ISP connection can be used. For example, your home network or a cafe free Wi-Fi.
How can I check if I\'m talking to the intended person?

At the settings screen you can see your identity key image. This is the point of identity at this application. You can export the key image and send it to your partner via other messenger. When you\'re connected to the partner, you can briefly check their identity key image at the \"About partner\" screen. You can also check the full version of the key there. IMPORTANT: the [IP-address]:[port] pair cannot be the point of identity check as it can be corrupted by the STUN server or other intruder, because it is sent in plaintext, without encryption. So, for confidential conversations ALWAYS check the identity of the person you\'re talking to. Remember: your confidentiality is in your and ONLY your hands, this application is provided to you without any express or implied guaranties. By continuing using this application, you agree with these terms.

As was mentioned above, the ordinal Internet user does not have a static address to connect to, instead of this they have [IP address]:[port] pair. But the user does not know this pair in advance, until their request reaches the Internet. So, STUN server is the server placed somewhere at the Internet, which tells the user their pair via STUN protocol. STUN is the standardized protocol, any many free STUN servers exist, so you can always change the used server at the settings.
Does STUN server participate in session?

Not at all. A STUN server\'s the only purpose is to tell the user their [IP address]:[port] pair, which was provided by the ISP. That\'s all. A STUN server does not receive any session data, either encrypted or decrypted and does not participate in any way in the conversation.
There are many free STUN servers. You can easily find their addresses by googling \"free STUN server\". Then, put the address in the corresponding field at the settings screen.

RSA-2048 key is used as the identity key, which serves as the point of identity in this application. RSA key is used only for signing. ECDH is used as the key agreement protocol. For symmetric encryption, AES256-GCM is used.
